description: The CAC Avon Sabre Mk.31 is a day fighter and fighter-bomber derived from the F-86F. It a development of the Mk.30 and has the original slatted wing replaced by the unslatted 6-3 wing, but retains the Avon 20 engine. The “Late” variant described here is from 1960 and after, and is fitted with two additional weapon stations for IRMs or, when used as a fighter-bomber, bombs.
loadnotes: May use 750L FTs on stations 1 and 4 and 400L FTs on stations 2 and 3.
